name: The Falklands War
description: The Falklands War was a military conflict that took place in 1982 between Argentina and the United Kingdom. The dispute was over the Falkland Islands, South Georgia, and South Sandwich Islands in the South Atlantic. Argentina invaded the Falkland Islands on April 2, 1982, and the UK responded by sending a task force to retake the islands. The conflict lasted for 74 days and resulted in the deaths of 649 Argentine military personnel, 255 British military personnel, and three Falkland Islanders. The war ended on June 14, 1982, when Argentine forces surrendered, and the islands were returned to British control. The war had significant political and military implications for both countries, and it is regarded as a significant event in the history of the region.

subUnits.name: HMS Endurance

state.title: HMS Endurance sails from Stanley with a Royal Marines detachment onboard

subUnits.description: A Royal Navy ice patrol vessel that served from 1967 to 1991.

subUnits.name: British Antarctic Survey
subUnits.description: The British Antarctic Survey (BAS) is the United Kingdom's national polar research institute. It has a dual purpose, to conduct polar science, enabling better understanding of global issues, and to provide an active presence in the Antarctic on behalf of the UK.

state.title: ARA Cabo San Antonio departs Stanley
Constantino Davidoff's working expedition leave Buenos Aires

subUnits.name: ARA Bahía Paraíso
subUnits.description: The ship operated as a naval auxiliary vessel from 1981 to 1986 and served in the Falklands War as a troop transport as well as hospital ship. It was involved in transporting troops to Leith Harbour prior to the Invasion of South Georgia.

properties.name: Maritime Exclusion Zone
properties.description: The Maritime Exclusion Zone (MEZ) declared on 12 April 1982 covered a circle of radius 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) from the centre of the Falkland Islands. Any Argentine warship or naval auxiliary entering the MEZ could have been attacked by British nuclear-powered submarines (SSN).

properties.name: Corbeta Uruguay base
properties.description: An Argentinian military outpost established in 1976

events.title: Argentine scrap workers raise Argentine flag on South Georgia
